body.name: Edward Tools Black Metal Dustpan 12” - Heavy Duty Powder Coated Steel Does not chip or Bend - Precision Edge for Small Item Sweeping - Loop Handle for Comfort/Hanging (1)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 11 hrs
features: Heavy duty powder coated steel that does not chip or bend like competing metal dustpans
Precision edge for easier sweeping small items
Looped ergonomic handle for easier grip and to allow hanging dust pan after use
body.description: Edward Tools Black Metal Dustpan 12” is the most heavy duty metal dust pan on the market. The premium powder coated steel will not chip or bend like other dust pans on the market. The looped handle is more comfortable and allows the dust pan to be hung up when not in use. This industrial dust pan’s edge is thin enough to sweep small items but thick enough to not bend. A ridge just inside the edge allows the swept items to stay inside while work. Edward Tools Black Metal Dust Pan 12” is the perfect size for a standard broom.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy duty dust pan
reviews.reviewText: Replaced old one similar!I like that it’s metal!Sturdy and well built

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Metal says it all, will last generations
reviews.reviewText: Wanted sturdy and long lasting, this dustpan is heavy gauge steel with easy grip welded handlec... other than its intended purpose it be used as a defensive weapon if need be...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Got to get it!
reviews.reviewText: I use it clean our new guinea pigs home. I love it! Light weight. Very durable. Very strong.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Saw from other reviewers that they had issues with the sticker residue on it. Mine came without a sticker and has worked extremely well for all my outdoor needs. Love the size and would recommend it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars great quality overall, but dirt still escapes
reviews.reviewText: I am frustrated with any and all dustpans that simply don't catch everything you're sweeping up. There is always a leftover line of dirt and you try to sweep it up from all angles until you give up and get the vacuum cleaner. I was hoping this one would be better--and it is. But not entirely. When I press it down to the floor, it seems to do better; maybe it just needs to be bent down a bit to form a totally straight edge against the floor. All in all, I am glad to have it. It is far better quality than any dust pan I've had before.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I thought
reviews.reviewText: This is exactly what I had in mind when I was thinking about a shop dust pan. Just like the in shop class. Not flimsy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Picking up Hair - Static Free
reviews.reviewText: Updated 12/2023. Bought a third one. Hurray, the seller listens, the dust pan no longer comes with an annoying sticker, just a sealed plastic bag. Still a solid dust pan, a bit more expensive than the old ones due to inflation.Old:Now that my wife and I are cutting each other's hair, we need to pick up the piles of cut hair afterwards. The metal dustpan together with a horse hair brush prevent static hair build up, making clean up that much easier. Others are correct about the sticky label, it is difficult to take off. You can leave the label on, it won't affect the dustpan's function, or you can soak the label in water to remove part of it, then remove the rest of it with Goo Be Gone. The pan is very sturdy, well worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very sturdy--people are right about getting the label off but it's not a deal breaker for me.
reviews.reviewText: This is such a sturdy dustpan. Also the edge is fine so one sweep and into the pan it goes. I don't have to keep sweeping and moving sweeping and moving. The people who complained about the sticker--yeah spot on--literally. But I don't care. I took off what I could easily. It seriously felt like letting it soak in hot water with Dawn dishwashing detergent is about all you would need to get off the rest but I'll update the review if that proves false. Right now it is an amazing dust pan--amazing. And it is pretty (outside the stuck label). And it will fit over your broom handle so the set stays together. I love it. Much better than the half dozen or so plastic ones I have bought over the last ten years.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sticker makes this a poor purchase.
reviews.reviewText: The Dir pan is fine. It’s light weight and should do the job. But the stupid 6x2” sticker on the front of the pan took 45 minutes to get off. What a dumb adhesive to use. And you can’t scrape it off without scratching the paint. Honestly if I would have known it was going to be that much of a pain to get off I would have bought a different one - there are many to choose from.
